title: [FEATURE] [Mac] Support mouse scroll-wheel touch handler on Mac
body:
On UWP, the mouse scroll wheel event is captured and passed in [SkTouchHandler.cs](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/2ad29861d5a40d3bf78c28ab0a9cb02a8f0fe437/source/SkiaSharp.Views.Forms/SkiaSharp.Views.Forms.UWP/SKTouchHandler.cs).

However the mouse wheel handling is missing on the Mac platform in [SkTouchHandler.cs](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/2ad29861d5a40d3bf78c28ab0a9cb02a8f0fe437/source/SkiaSharp.Views.Forms/SkiaSharp.Views.Forms.Mac/SKTouchHandler.cs).

It would be useful if the Mac platform could also capture and generate an `SkTouchEvent` when the mouse wheel is scrolled.

For now, as a work-around we have been able to add a custom renderer for Mac, and overriding the NSResponder `ScrollWheel` [event](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nsresponder/1534192-scrollwheel), as it is part of the Xamarin.Mac [AppKit](https://learn.microsoft.com/cs-cz/dotnet/api/appkit.nsresponder.scrollwheel?view=xamarin-mac-sdk-14).

Can support for the scroll wheel on Mac be added to SkiaSharp by default, to avoid needing to add a separate custom renderer?
